00070 #ifndef _SYMBOL_TABLE_INCLUDED_
00071 #define _SYMBOL_TABLE_INCLUDED_
00072 
00073 //
00074 // Symbol table for parsing.  Has these design characteristics:
00075 //
00076 // * Same symbol table can be used to compile many shaders, to preserve
00077 //   effort of creating and loading with the large numbers of built-in
00078 //   symbols.
00079 //
00080 // * Name mangling will be used to give each function a unique name
00081 //   so that symbol table lookups are never ambiguous.  This allows
00082 //   a simpler symbol table structure.
00083 //
00084 // * Pushing and popping of scope, so symbol table will really be a stack 
00085 //   of symbol tables.  Searched from the top, with new inserts going into
00086 //   the top.
00087 //
00088 // * Constants:  Compile time constant symbols will keep their values
00089 //   in the symbol table.  The parser can substitute constants at parse
00090 //   time, including doing constant folding and constant propagation.
00091 //
00092 // * No temporaries:  Temporaries made from operations (+, --, .xy, etc.)
00093 //   are tracked in the intermediate representation, not the symbol table.
00094 //
00095 
00096 #include "Include/Common.h"
00097 #include "Include/intermediate.h"
00098 #include "Include/InfoSink.h"
00099  
00100 //
00101 // Symbol base class.  (Can build functions or variables out of these...)
00102 //
00103 class TSymbol {    
00104 public:
00105    POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE(GlobalPoolAllocator)
00106    TSymbol(const TString *n) :  name(n), info(0) { }
00107    TSymbol(const TString *n, const TTypeInfo *i) :  name(n), info(i) { }
00108    virtual ~TSymbol() { /* don't delete name, it's from the pool */ }
00109    const TString& getName() const { return *name; }
00110    const TTypeInfo* getInfo() const { return info; }
00111    void setInfo( const TTypeInfo *i) {  info = i; }
00112    virtual const TString& getMangledName() const { return getName(); }
00113    virtual bool isFunction() const { return false; }
00114    virtual bool isVariable() const { return false; }
00115    void setUniqueId(int id) { uniqueId = id; }
00116    int getUniqueId() const { return uniqueId; }
00117    virtual void dump(TInfoSink &infoSink) const = 0;  
00118    TSymbol(const TSymbol&);
00119    virtual TSymbol* clone(TStructureMap& remapper) = 0;
00120 
00121 protected:
00122    const TString *name;
00123    const TTypeInfo *info;
00124    unsigned int uniqueId;      // For real comparing during code generation
00125 };
00126 
00127 //
00128 // Variable class, meaning a symbol that's not a function.
00129 // 
00130 // There could be a separate class heirarchy for Constant variables;
00131 // Only one of int, bool, or float, (or none) is correct for
00132 // any particular use, but it's easy to do this way, and doesn't
00133 // seem worth having separate classes, and "getConst" can't simply return
00134 // different values for different types polymorphically, so this is 
00135 // just simple and pragmatic.
00136 //
00137 class TVariable : public TSymbol {
00138 public:
00139    TVariable(const TString *name, const TType& t, bool uT = false ) : TSymbol(name), type(t), userType(uT), unionArray(0), arrayInformationType(0) { }
00140    TVariable(const TString *name, const TTypeInfo* info, const TType& t, bool uT = false ) : TSymbol(name, info), type(t), userType(uT), unionArray(0), arrayInformationType(0) { }
00141    virtual ~TVariable() { }
00142    virtual bool isVariable() const { return true; }    
00143    TType& getType() { return type; }    
00144    const TType& getType() const { return type; }
00145    bool isUserType() const { return userType; }
00146    void changeQualifier(TQualifier qualifier) { type.changeQualifier(qualifier); }
00147    void updateArrayInformationType(TType *t) { arrayInformationType = t; }
00148    TType* getArrayInformationType() { return arrayInformationType; }
00149 
00150    virtual void dump(TInfoSink &infoSink) const;
00151 
00152    constUnion* getConstPointer() 
00153    { 
00154       if (!unionArray)
00155          unionArray = new constUnion[type.getObjectSize()];
00156 
00157       return unionArray;
00158    }
00159 
00160    constUnion* getConstPointer() const { return unionArray; }
00161 
00162    void shareConstPointer( constUnion *constArray)
00163    {
00164       delete unionArray;
00165       unionArray = constArray;  
00166    }
00167    TVariable(const TVariable&, TStructureMap& remapper); // copy constructor
00168    virtual TVariable* clone(TStructureMap& remapper);
00169       
00170 protected:
00171    TType type;
00172    bool userType;
00173    // we are assuming that Pool Allocator will free the memory allocated to unionArray
00174    // when this object is destroyed
00175    constUnion *unionArray;
00176    TType *arrayInformationType;  // this is used for updating maxArraySize in all the references to a given symbol
00177 };
00178 
00179 //
00180 // The function sub-class of symbols and the parser will need to
00181 // share this definition of a function parameter.
00182 //
00183 struct TParameter 
00184 {
00185    TString *name;
00186    const TTypeInfo *info;
00187    TType* type;
00188    void copyParam(const TParameter& param, TStructureMap& remapper) 
00189    {
00190       name = NewPoolTString(param.name->c_str());      
00191       info = param.info; //sharing
00192       type = param.type->clone(remapper);
00193    }
00194    static TString* NullSemantic;
00195 };
00196 
00197 //
00198 // The function sub-class of a symbol.  
00199 //
00200 class TFunction : public TSymbol 
00201 {
00202 public:
00203    TFunction(TOperator o) :
00204         TSymbol(0),
00205         returnType(TType(EbtVoid)),
00206         op(o),
00207         defined(false) { }
00208    TFunction(const TString *name, TType& retType, TOperator tOp = EOpNull) : 
00209         TSymbol(name), 
00210         returnType(retType),
00211         mangledName(*name + '('),
00212         op(tOp),
00213         defined(false) { }
00214    TFunction(const TString *name, const TTypeInfo* info, TType& retType, TOperator tOp = EOpNull) : 
00215         TSymbol(name, info), 
00216         returnType(retType),
00217         mangledName(*name + '('),
00218         op(tOp),
00219         defined(false) { }
00220    virtual ~TFunction();
00221    virtual bool isFunction() const { return true; }    
00222     
00223    void addParameter(TParameter& p) 
00224    { 
00225       parameters.push_back(p);
00226       mangledName = mangledName + p.type->getMangledName();
00227    }
00228     
00229    const TString& getMangledName() const { return mangledName; }
00230    const TType& getReturnType() const { return returnType; }
00231    void relateToOperator(TOperator o) { op = o; }
00232    TOperator getBuiltInOp() const { return op; }
00233    void setDefined() { defined = true; }
00234    bool isDefined() { return defined; }
00235 
00236    int getParamCount() const { return static_cast<int>(parameters.size()); }    
00237    TParameter& operator [](int i)       { return parameters[i]; }
00238    const TParameter& operator [](int i) const { return parameters[i]; }
00239     
00240    virtual void dump(TInfoSink &infoSink) const;
00241    TFunction(const TFunction&, TStructureMap& remapper);
00242    virtual TFunction* clone(TStructureMap& remapper);
00243     
00244 protected:
00245    typedef TVector<TParameter> TParamList;
00246    TParamList parameters;
00247    TType returnType;
00248    TString mangledName;
00249    TOperator op;
00250    bool defined;
00251 };

00253 
00254 class TSymbolTableLevel 
00255 {
00256 public:
00257    POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE(GlobalPoolAllocator)
00258    TSymbolTableLevel() { }
00259    ~TSymbolTableLevel();
00260     
00261    bool insert(TSymbol& symbol) 
00262    {
00263       //
00264       // returning true means symbol was added to the table
00265       //
00266       tInsertResult result;
00267       result = level.insert(tLevelPair(symbol.getMangledName(), &symbol));
00268 
00269       return result.second;
00270    }
00271 
00272    TSymbol* find(const TString& name) const
00273    {
00274       tLevel::const_iterator it = level.find(name);
00275       if (it == level.end())
00276          return 0;
00277       else
00278          return (*it).second;
00279    }
00280 
00281    // vector might be best switched to a special allocator
00282    TSymbol* findCompatible( const TFunction *call, bool &ambiguous) const;
00283 
00284    void relateToOperator(const char* name, TOperator op);
00285    void dump(TInfoSink &infoSink) const;
00286    TSymbolTableLevel* clone(TStructureMap& remapper);
00287     
00288 protected:
00289    typedef std::map<TString, TSymbol*, std::less<TString>, pool_allocator<std::pair<const TString, TSymbol*> > > tLevel;
00290    typedef const tLevel::value_type tLevelPair;
00291    typedef std::pair<tLevel::iterator, bool> tInsertResult;
00292 
00293    tLevel level;
00294 };
00295 
00296 class TSymbolTable {
00297 public:
00298    TSymbolTable() : uniqueId(0)
00299    {
00300       //
00301       // The symbol table cannot be used until push() is called, but
00302       // the lack of an initial call to push() can be used to detect
00303       // that the symbol table has not been preloaded with built-ins.
00304       //
00305    }
00306 
00307    TSymbolTable(TSymbolTable& symTable)
00308    {
00309       table.push_back(symTable.table[0]);
00310       uniqueId = symTable.uniqueId;
00311    }
00312 
00313    ~TSymbolTable()
00314    {
00315       // level 0 is always built In symbols, so we never pop that out
00316       while (table.size() > 1)
00317          pop();
00318    }
00319 
00320    //
00321    // When the symbol table is initialized with the built-ins, there should
00322    // 'push' calls, so that built-ins are at level 0 and the shader
00323    // globals are at level 1.
00324    //
00325    bool isEmpty() { return table.size() == 0; }
00326    bool atBuiltInLevel() { return atSharedBuiltInLevel() || atDynamicBuiltInLevel(); }
00327    bool atSharedBuiltInLevel() { return table.size() == 1; }   
00328    bool atGlobalLevel() { return table.size() <= 3; }
00329    void push() 
00330    { 
00331       table.push_back(new TSymbolTableLevel);
00332    }
00333 
00334    void pop() 
00335    { 
00336       delete table[currentLevel()]; 
00337       table.pop_back(); 
00338    }
00339 
00340    bool insert(TSymbol& symbol)
00341    {
00342       symbol.setUniqueId(++uniqueId);
00343       return table[currentLevel()]->insert(symbol);
00344    }
00345     
00346    TSymbol* find(const TString& name, bool* builtIn = 0, bool *sameScope = 0) 
00347    {
00348       int level = currentLevel();
00349       TSymbol* symbol;
00350       do 
00351       {
00352          symbol = table[level]->find(name);
00353          --level;
00354       } while (symbol == 0 && level >= 0);
00355       level++;
00356       if (builtIn)
00357          *builtIn = level == 0;
00358       if (sameScope)
00359          *sameScope = level == currentLevel();
00360       return symbol;
00361    }
00362 
00363    TSymbol* findCompatible(const TFunction* call, bool *builtIn, bool &ambiguous) 
00364    {
00365       int level = currentLevel();
00366       TSymbol *symbol = 0;
00367       ambiguous = false;
00368 
00369       do 
00370       {
00371          symbol = table[level]->findCompatible(call, ambiguous);
00372          --level;
00373       } while ( symbol == 0 && level >= 0 && !ambiguous);
00374       level++;
00375       if (builtIn)
00376          *builtIn = level == 0;
00377       //if (sameScope)
00378       //    *sameScope = level == currentLevel();
00379       return symbol;
00380    }
00381 
00382    TSymbolTableLevel* getGlobalLevel() { assert(table.size() >= 3); return table[2]; }
00383    void relateToOperator(const char* name, TOperator op) { table[0]->relateToOperator(name, op); }
00384    int getMaxSymbolId() { return uniqueId; }
00385    void dump(TInfoSink &infoSink) const;
00386    void copyTable(const TSymbolTable& copyOf);
00387 
00388 protected:    
00389    int currentLevel() const { return static_cast<int>(table.size()) - 1; }
00390    bool atDynamicBuiltInLevel() { return table.size() == 2; }
00391 
00392    std::vector<TSymbolTableLevel*> table;
00393    int uniqueId;     // for unique identification in code generation
00394 };
00395 
00396 #endif // _SYMBOL_TABLE_INCLUDED_
